qas.question: How does Whitehead define he consequent nature of God?

answers.text: God's reception of the world's activity

qas.question: How does Whitehead describe the judgment of God?

answers.text: It is the judgment of a tenderness which loses nothing that can be saved.

qas.question: What does Whitehead say that God does with all experiences?

answers.text: God saves and cherishes all experiences forever

qas.question: What effect does Whitehead claim that experiences have on God?

answers.text: those experiences go on to change the way God interacts with the world

qas.question: What conclusion does Whitehead draw about God's treatment of humans' experiences?

answers.text: God is really changed by what happens in the world and the wider universe, lending the actions of finite creatures an eternal significance.

plausible_answers.text: God's reception of the world's activity

qas.question: How does Whitehead define inconsequent nature of God?

plausible_answers.text: It is the judgment of a tenderness which loses nothing that can be saved

qas.question: How does Whitehead not describe the judgment of God?

plausible_answers.text: God saves and cherishes all experiences forever

qas.question: What does Whitehead say that God does with no experiences?

plausible_answers.text: God is really changed by what happens in the world and the wider universe

qas.question: What conclusion does Whitehead draw about God's treatment of humans' inexperiences?

context: God's consequent nature, on the other hand, is anything but unchanging – it is <a0_0><b5_0>God's reception of the world's activity<b5_0/><a0_0/>. As Whitehead puts it, "[God] saves the world as it passes into the immediacy of his own life. <a1_0><b6_0>It is the judgment of a tenderness which loses nothing that can be saved<b6_0/>.<a1_0/>" In other words, <a2_0><b7_0>God saves and cherishes all experiences forever<b7_0/><a2_0/>, and <a3_0>those experiences go on to change the way God interacts with the world<a3_0/>. In this way, <a4_0><b8_0>God is really changed by what happens in the world and the wider universe<b8_0/>, lending the actions of finite creatures an eternal significance.
